trans-unit.source: Translations for Variable Options

seg-source.mrk: Translations for Variable Options

trans-unit.source: Similar to the translation functionality for Checklist Line descriptions, it also is possible to use translations for Variable Options in Checklist Lines.

seg-source.mrk: Similar to the translation functionality for Checklist Line descriptions, it also is possible to use translations for Variable Options in Checklist Lines.

trans-unit.source: Example – Add Translations to Variable Options

seg-source.mrk: Example – Add Translations to Variable Options

trans-unit.source: In this example, the COLOUR variable is set up with four options in German (blau, grün, rot, and gelb). Some of the ENU translations were created in the topic <MadCap:xref href="Find Create Translation Function.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Find/Create Translation Function” on page 1</MadCap:xref> and therefore added to the Variable Options; and a new translation for “gelb” is created.

seg-source.mrk: In this example, the COLOUR variable is set up with four options in German (blau, grün, rot, and gelb).

Some of the ENU translations were created in the topic <MadCap:xref href="Find Create Translation Function.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Find/Create Translation Function” on page 1</MadCap:xref> and therefore added to the Variable Options; and a new translation for “gelb” is created.

trans-unit.source: : German text assigned to the COLOUR variable options

seg-source.mrk: : German text assigned to the COLOUR variable options

trans-unit.source: The Translation Code field can be filled out by using the lookup or by using the “Find/Create Translations” function. This function works in the same way as in Checklist Templates: first it searches for existing translations for the Description; if no translation is found, a new one is created. The found or created Translation Code will be inserted to the Translation Code field.

seg-source.mrk: The Translation Code field can be filled out by using the lookup or by using the “Find/Create Translations” function.
This function works in the same way as in Checklist Templates: first it searches for existing translations for the Description; if no translation is found, a new one is created.
The found or created Translation Code will be inserted to the Translation Code field.

trans-unit.source: Running the “Find/Create Translations” function first generates a confirmation message, then upon acceptance, generates another message that asks which language is used because a language code cannot be selected in the Variable Options page. Upon clicking OK, the Languages page opens for language selection.

seg-source.mrk: Running the “Find/Create Translations” function first generates a confirmation message, then upon acceptance, generates another message that asks which language is used because a language code cannot be selected in the Variable Options page.
Upon clicking OK, the Languages page opens for language selection.

trans-unit.source: : German language selected for the variable option translations

seg-source.mrk: : German language selected for the variable option translations

trans-unit.source: The DEU (German) language is selected and then OK is clicked. The Variable Options page is updated with the existing and created translation codes.

seg-source.mrk: The DEU (German) language is selected and then OK is clicked.
The Variable Options page is updated with the existing and created translation codes.

trans-unit.source: : Variable Options with German text but no translations

seg-source.mrk: : Variable Options with German text but no translations

trans-unit.source: The ENU translations are displayed for the existing translation codes. Since the created translation for “gelb” only has an entry for Language=DEU, a message appears instead of a translation in the Description (T) field. The ENU translation for “gelb” can be entered in the Translation Header page.

seg-source.mrk: The ENU translations are displayed for the existing translation codes.
Since the created translation for “gelb” only has an entry for Language=DEU, a message appears instead of a translation in the Description (T) field.
The ENU translation for “gelb” can be entered in the Translation Header page.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Find Create Translation Function.htm#TransCLTemp" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Translations on Checklist Templates” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information about setting up translations.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Find Create Translation Function.htm#TransCLTemp" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Translations on Checklist Templates” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information about setting up translations.

trans-unit.source: Variable Option Translations on Document Checklists

seg-source.mrk: Variable Option Translations on Document Checklists

trans-unit.source: Once the translations have been set up on the Variables Options, the translated text can appear in the Input Description (T) field on the document Checklists using the same method as in the Checklist Template.

seg-source.mrk: Once the translations have been set up on the Variables Options, the translated text can appear in the Input Description (T) field on the document Checklists using the same method as in the Checklist Template.

trans-unit.source: : Input options for the COLOUR variables on Document Checklist

seg-source.mrk: : Input options for the COLOUR variables on Document Checklist

trans-unit.source: After the variable option is selected, the text for the selected language appears in the Input Description (T) field; in this example, the English text is displays because ENU is the selected language in the header.

seg-source.mrk: After the variable option is selected, the text for the selected language appears in the Input Description (T) field; in this example, the English text is displays because ENU is the selected language in the header.

trans-unit.source: : Base language in the Input Description (T) field

seg-source.mrk: : Base language in the Input Description (T) field
